Photo: Wayno Beam | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Muscle Shoals, Alabama]], [[USA]] | genre = [[Rock and roll|Rock & Roll]] | years_active = 2004-Current | label = [[Heart of Gold Records]] | associated_acts = [[Heart of Gold Band]] | website = [http://thisisboombox.com www.thisisboombox.com] }} '''BoomBox''' is an American [[rock band]], which is most known for its quick rise into the Jam band music scene and through founding member Zion Godchaux's association with the [[Grateful Dead]]. Both parents, [[Keith Godchaux|Keith]] and [[Donna Jean Godchaux]], performed with the band from 1971 to 1979.{{cite web|url=http://www.highcountrypress.com/weekly/2011/10-13-11/get-down-with-boombox.htm |title='Get Downâ with BoomBox at Legends October 20| Jesse Wood |publisher=highcountrypress.com |date=2011-10-13 |accessdate=2011-11-04}} ==History== ===Formation=== Formed in 2004 by singer/songwriter [[Zion Godchaux (musician)|Zion Godchaux]] on the [[guitar]]/[[lead vocals]] and producer/DJ [[Russ Randolph (musician)|Russ Randolph]] on sequencers, groove boxes and turn-tables. The duo met while recording the [[Heart of Gold Band]] album âAt The Table,â with Zion's mother [[Donna Godchaux|Donna Jean Godchaux-Mackay]].[http://www.dead.net/band/donna-jean-godchaux Donna Jean Godchaux. BoomBox originates from [[Muscle Shoals, Alabama]], known as a revolutionary hot spot for recording studios and creative artists in [[Rock and Roll]] and [[Rhythm and blues]].http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=1437161 BoomBox has incorporated some of this history into their music, allowing for a contemporary style and coupling of [[Rock and Roll]], [[Psychedelic rock|Vintage Psychedelic]] and [[House music|House]]. ==Musical style== ===Techniques=== The duo themselves avoid labeling the music as anything other than "Rock & Roll", expressing that labels would do the music injustice. It's simply left up to each person to extract his or her own account from the BoomBox experience.[http://blog.mlive.com/kalamazoo_gazette_extra/2007/11/bamas_boombox_to_bring_funky_s.html ''Bama's BoomBox to bring 'funky, sweaty dance party''], Kalamazoo Gazette (2007-11-01) ==Other== ===Festivals=== The band has played many notable concerts and venues, including appearances at [[Oregon Country Fair|The Oregon Country Fair]], [[The Echo Project]], [[Wakarusa Music & Camping Festival]] and [[Rothbury Music Festival]]. ==Discography== *[[Visions of Backbeat]] (May, 2005) *Downriverelectric (June, 2010) ==Notes== ==External links== *[http://www.thisisboombox.com The Official BoomBox Website] *[http://www.archive.org/details/BoomBox BoomBox collection] at the [[Internet Archive]]'s live music archive {{DEFAULTSORT:BoomBox}} [[Category:Musical groups from Alabama]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2004]] [[Category:Jam bands]] {{US-rock-band-stub}}
